intro: Erysimum brevicaule, commonly known as the dwarf wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and has a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
